response.name: Information Technology
response.description: The sector of Information Technology is concerned with the use of computers and telecommunications equipment to store, retrieve, transmit and manipulate data, often in the context of business or other enterprises.

response.name: EHS - Environment, Health and Safety
response.description: EHS is a discipline and specialty that studies and implements practical aspects of environmental protection and safety at work. In simple terms, it is what organizations must do to make sure that their activities do not cause harm to anyone.

response.name: Education
response.description: The Education sector encompasses a range of educational services including early childhood education, schools, tertiary education, vocational education and training, adult and community education, and educational support services.

response.name: BFSI - Banking, Financial Services Insurance
response.description: BFSI stands for Banking, Financial Services, and Insurance. BFSI typically refers to companies that provide a range of such financial products/services, including universal banks, brokerage firms, insurance companies, and mutual funds.

response.name: Arts
response.description: The Arts sector covers a wide array of activities related to the creation, execution, and exhibition of art forms like visual arts, performing arts, literature, music, and design. It focuses on expression, creativity, and aesthetics, contributing significantly to cultural heritage and education.
